alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 7:57PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 845 PM MST... At 757 PM MST, the public reported intense snow showers along a line extending from 6 miles south of Evaro to 10 miles southwest of Wye. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. Snow rates up to 2 inch per hour have been reported with this line. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside, Wye, East Missoula, Twin Creeks and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 95 and 113. Highway 93 S between mile markers 83 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
